document_type: Licence Conditions and Codes of Practice (LCCP) - Personal Licence Conditions

document_overview.purpose: Specifies personal licence conditions for individuals holding personal licences issued by the UK Gambling Commission
document_overview.structure: Single section with core conditions and notification requirements
document_overview.compliance_obligation: Mandatory conditions for all personal licence holders
document_overview.enforcement: Breach may result in: suspension or revocation of personal licence, financial penalties, disqualification from holding personal licences, consideration of suitability to hold operating or premises licences

personal_licence_types.scope: Individual responsible for corporate governance and board-level decisions
Individual with significant influence over compliance and operations
Individual responsible for ensuring licence compliance
Individual responsible for AML/CFT compliance and reporting
Individual with technical competence in remote gambling systems
Individual with technical competence in gaming machines
Individual responsible for non-remote gaming machine compliance

provision_types.breach_consequence: Breach may lead to: licence review with view to suspension/revocation, financial penalty, disqualification from holding personal licences, consideration of fitness and propriety
provision_types.enforcement_discretion: Commission exercises full discretion in enforcement

sections.section_overview: Core responsibilities and notification obligations for all personal licence holders

provisions.provision_title: Responsibility to avoid breach by operating licence holder
provisions.provision_summary: Personal licence holders must take all reasonable steps to ensure their actions do not cause the operating or premises licence holder to breach licence conditions

key_requirements.requirement: Take all reasonable steps to prevent licence holder breach
key_requirements.detail: Personal licence holders must take all reasonable steps to ensure that the way in which they carry out their responsibilities in relation to licensed activities does not place the holder of the operating or any relevant premises licence in breach of their licence conditions
key_requirements.compliance_action: Understand licence conditions applicable to operating/premises licences; ensure actions comply with those conditions; escalate concerns about potential breaches
key_requirements.responsibility_scope: Applies to all actions and responsibilities undertaken by personal licence holder in carrying out licensed activities

provisions.enforcement_consequence: Breach of this condition may result in Commission reviewing suitability of personal licence holder; may result in licence variation, suspension or revocation

provisions.provision_summary: Personal licence holders must stay current with gambling legislation, codes of practice, Commission guidance, and maintain technical competence for functional roles

key_requirements.detail: Personal licence holders must keep themselves informed of developments in gambling legislation
key_requirements.compliance_action: Regularly review Gambling Act 2005 and subordinate legislation; subscribe to Commission updates; attend relevant training

key_requirements.requirement: Keep informed of codes of practice
key_requirements.detail: Keep informed of developments in codes of practice
key_requirements.compliance_action: Review LCCP updates; understand how CoP provisions apply to licensed operator's activities; communicate changes to staff

key_requirements.detail: Keep informed of any Commission guidance relevant to their role, whether issued on Commission website or communicated directly to licence holders
key_requirements.compliance_action: Monitor Commission website for guidance; respond to direct Commission communications; seek clarification on guidance where necessary

key_requirements.detail: Holders of personal functional licences must keep their technical competence in respect of their licensed activities up to date
key_requirements.compliance_action: Undertake regular technical training; maintain certifications; stay current with technical standards and developments

provisions.enforcement_consequence: Breach may demonstrate lack of fitness and propriety for personal licence; may result in suspension or revocation

provisions.provision_summary: Personal licence holders must notify Commission of specified key events within 10 working days of becoming aware of their occurrence

key_requirements.detail: Personal licence holders must notify the Commission of the occurrence of any key events within 10 working days after the licensee becomes aware of the event's occurrence
key_requirements.compliance_action: Establish internal procedures to identify key events; track dates of awareness; ensure Commission notification within 10 working days
key_requirements.calculation: 10 working days excludes weekends and UK bank holidays; starts from date personal licence holder became aware of event

key_requirements.detail: Subject to any criminal investigation listed under Schedule 7 Relevant Offences of the Gambling Act 2005
key_requirements.compliance_action: Immediately upon becoming aware of any criminal investigation related to Relevant Offences, notify Commission within 10 working days

key_requirements.detail: Conviction of any offence listed under Schedule 7 - Relevant Offences of the Gambling Act 2005
key_requirements.compliance_action: Notify Commission of conviction within 10 working days of becoming aware; provide court documents and sentencing information
key_requirements.scope: All relevant offences under Schedule 7, regardless of sentence or severity

key_requirements.detail: Any current or pending investigation by a professional, statutory, regulatory or government body in Great Britain or abroad
key_requirements.compliance_action: Notify Commission of any investigation by: professional bodies (accounting, legal, medical, etc.), statutory bodies, regulatory authorities (financial, gambling, etc.), government bodies (tax, customs, etc.), or equivalent overseas bodies
key_requirements.scope: Includes investigations in any jurisdiction, not limited to GB

key_requirements.detail: The imposition of any sanction or penalty against them following an investigation by any professional, statutory, regulatory or government body in Great Britain or abroad
key_requirements.compliance_action: Notify Commission of any sanctions, penalties, fines, or other consequences imposed by professional, regulatory, or government bodies; provide details of sanction and reason
key_requirements.scope: All types of sanctions and penalties from any jurisdiction

key_requirements.detail: The imposition of a disciplinary sanction against them, including dismissal, for gross misconduct
key_requirements.compliance_action: Notify Commission of any disciplinary action including: formal warnings, suspension, demotion, or dismissal for gross misconduct; provide details of misconduct and sanction
key_requirements.trigger: Applies specifically to disciplinary sanctions for gross misconduct

key_requirements.detail: Resignation from a position for which a personal licence is required following commencement of disciplinary proceedings in respect of gross misconduct
key_requirements.compliance_action: Notify Commission if personal licence holder resigns from personal licensed role following commencement of gross misconduct proceedings; state the position resigned from and nature of gross misconduct allegations
key_requirements.trigger: Must notify even if proceedings not concluded; must have been formally commenced before resignation

key_requirements.detail: Disqualification from acting as a company director
key_requirements.compliance_action: Notify Commission of any disqualification from acting as company director (including automatic disqualification, voluntary, or Court-ordered); provide details of disqualification period and reason
key_requirements.scope: Disqualification under Companies House rules or Court orders in any jurisdiction

key_requirements.detail: The presentation of a petition for their bankruptcy or sequestration or their entering into an individual voluntary agreement
key_requirements.compliance_action: Notify Commission of: (a) presentation of bankruptcy petition, (b) sequestration order (Scotland), (c) entry into Individual Voluntary Agreement (IVA); provide details of proceedings and dates
key_requirements.scope: Notification required at presentation/commencement stage, not only if proceedings finalized

key_requirements.detail: A change in their name or address
key_requirements.compliance_action: Notify Commission of: (a) any legal name change (marriage, deed poll, etc.), (b) change of residential address or correspondence address; provide new details and effective date of change
key_requirements.scope: Any formal change to name or address used in connection with personal licence

notification_procedure.timeline: Within 10 working days of becoming aware
notification_procedure.method: Submit notification to Commission via designated route (typically online portal or email to specified address)
notification_procedure.content: Include: event description, dates, relevant details, supporting documentation where available
notification_procedure.evidence: Retain evidence of notification date for compliance records

provisions.enforcement_consequence: Failure to notify key events within 10 working days is breach of personal licence condition; may result in: financial penalty, suspension or revocation of personal licence, consideration of suitability for future licensing

provisions.provision_summary: Definition and reference to Schedule 7 Relevant Offences under Gambling Act 2005

key_requirements.detail: Personal licence holders should familiarize themselves with Schedule 7 Relevant Offences of the Gambling Act 2005 to understand which criminal investigations and convictions must be notified
key_requirements.compliance_action: Review Schedule 7 Relevant Offences; understand which offences trigger notification requirement; seek legal advice if uncertain

key_requirements.detail: Schedule 7 Relevant Offences include offences related to fraud, dishonesty, money laundering, and other crimes of dishonesty
key_requirements.compliance_action: Assume broad interpretation; notify Commission of any investigation or conviction related to offences of dishonesty, financial crime, or gambling-related offences

key_requirements.detail: If uncertain whether investigation or conviction falls under Schedule 7, err on side of caution and notify Commission
key_requirements.compliance_action: Contact Commission if unsure; provide information and allow Commission to determine relevance

provisions.provision_summary: Personal licence holders must maintain standards of fitness and propriety throughout licence duration

key_requirements.detail: Personal licence holders must maintain the fitness and propriety standards that were met at time of licence grant throughout duration of licence
key_requirements.compliance_action: Regularly assess whether continuing to meet fitness and propriety criteria; take steps to maintain integrity and competence; avoid conduct that would demonstrate unfitness

key_requirements.detail: Fitness and propriety assessed based on: integrity, competence, financial soundness, absence of undischarged criminal liability, suitability given personal circumstances
key_requirements.compliance_action: Understand Commission's fitness and propriety criteria; ensure conduct aligns with expected standards

key_requirements.detail: Key events listed in 1.2.1 may demonstrate loss of fitness and propriety and may trigger Commission action
key_requirements.compliance_action: Recognize that notification of key events may trigger Commission review of personal licence holder's suitability

provisions.enforcement_consequence: Breach or loss of fitness and propriety may result in immediate suspension or revocation of personal licence

key_principles: Personal licence conditions are mandatory conditions of personal licence
All personal licence holders subject to same core conditions regardless of role
Functional licence holders (technical roles) have additional technical competence requirements
Key event notification is strict 10 working day obligation - no discretion or exceptions
Personal licence holders have ongoing responsibility to maintain fitness and propriety
Failure to comply may result in immediate licence suspension or revocation
implementation_approach: Ensure understanding of personal licence conditions at point of grant
Establish internal procedures to identify and track key events
Create notification protocols with clear 10 working day timeline
Maintain records of all notifications sent to Commission
Regularly review gambling legislation and Commission guidance
For functional licence holders: maintain technical competence through regular training and development
Proactively engage with Commission on any concerns about fitness and propriety
key_event_categories: Criminal investigations related to Schedule 7 Relevant Offences
Criminal convictions for Schedule 7 Relevant Offences
Sanctions or penalties from professional/regulatory bodies
Disciplinary sanctions including dismissal for gross misconduct
Resignation following commencement of gross misconduct proceedings

commission_publications: Statement of principles for licensing and regulation
